body_html:
@jmoraleda Perhaps you can try to uninstall first?

Note the instructions here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux#install_tensorflow

The sequence of commands should be:

$ sudo pip3 uninstall tensorflow # for Python 3.n
$ pip3 install tensorflow-gpu # Python 3.n; GPU support

Only if that fails, try this (for Python 3.5 with GPU support):

$ sudo pip3 uninstall tensorflow # for Python 3.n
$ sudo pip3 install --upgrade \
https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.0.0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl

Note the instructions here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux#install_tensorflow
The sequence of commands should be:
$ sudo pip3 uninstall tensorflow # for Python 3.n
$ pip3 install tensorflow-gpu # Python 3.n; GPU support 

Only if that fails, try this (for Python 3.5 with GPU support):
$ sudo pip3 uninstall tensorflow # for Python 3.n
$ sudo pip3 install --upgrade \
https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.0.0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
body:
@jmoraleda Perhaps you can try to uninstall first?

Note the instructions here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux#install_tensorflow

The sequence of commands should be:
```
$ sudo pip3 uninstall tensorflow # for Python 3.n
$ pip3 install tensorflow-gpu # Python 3.n; GPU support 
```

Only if that fails, try this (for Python 3.5 with GPU support):
```
$ sudo pip3 uninstall tensorflow # for Python 3.n
$ sudo pip3 install --upgrade \
https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.0.0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
```
